title: Child Psychology and Developmental Science
headline: This free online course covers the principal theories of child psychology and the instruments of developmental science.
description: What factors must you consider in a child's infancy? What is 'emotional attachment’ and how do you deal with it? Child psychology is one of the numerous subfields of psychology. This course examines the fundamental principles and categories of child psychology and developmental science. In addition, we examine psychological theory and the developmental change pattern. You will investigate dynamic systems and resource use.
courseDescription:
Child psychology is one of the many branches of psychology. This area focuses on growing children's minds and behaviours from prenatal to adolescence. This course examines the methodologies and features of child psychology and developmental science. You will gain an understanding of patterns of developmental change. You will learn how to investigate dynamic systems and get vital knowledge about ethological and evolutionary factors. 

The course then prepares you by studying prenatal development in action. Gain knowledge about child infancy and the theories surrounding emotional attachment in children. Next, you will learn about the importance of language and communication and how to analyse the information processing approach and explore fundamental change.

If you are new to child psychology, this course will teach you how to use and understand the fundamental theories around developmental science. We equip you with an account of the exact views and tools so that you can incorporate them into your studies. This course is a great starting point for individuals who are just beginning to learn about the ins and outs of child psychology and developmental science - enrol today.
